column1: The  Learned  Counsel  for  the  accused-appellants  had  restricted  his  appeal  to  four  grounds  of appeal
before this court. The said grounds can be summarized as follows,

column2: Procedure  adopted  with  regard  to  the  change  of jury option was  irregular  and  illegal,  because
the accused did not communicate through their mouth but through their counsel.
The prosecution failed  to  produce the conditional pardon papers to  prove that such pardon was

given-conviction  based  on 
the  evidence  of  co-accused 
treated/considered  as 
independent
prosecution witness .... with no  corroboration addressed.
